title: AI-Driven Operational Efficiencies and Corporate Governance Partnerships
description: IHC has leveraged AI-driven efficiencies and pioneered the integration of Aiden Insight, an AI-powered virtual entity, as a Board Observer to enhance corporate governance. This reflects an openness to advanced technology integration at both operational and management levels.
example: AI/tech companies developing board governance tools or AI-based decision support systems can partner with IHC or its subsidiaries to further digitalize boardrooms and portfolio management. This could include offering proprietary AI governance tech or customizing workflow automation for asset management companies within the IHC portfolio.
roadmap: Step 1: AI tech company approaches IHC/its subsidiaries with a proposal for pilot integration.
Step 2: Identify and customize governance/operational modules for IHC’s boardrooms or back-office.
Step 3: Run pilot in a chosen subsidiary or segment of IHC.
Step 4: Measure ROI and present results to IHC leadership.
Step 5: Expand deployment across other IHC entities.
source_name: IHC Achieves Landmark Growth in 2024, Reinforcing Its Position as a Global Investment Powerhouse

title: Joint Investments & Co-Investment in Real Estate Mega-Projects
description: The formation of one of the UAE’s largest real estate entities by combining Modon Properties, ADNEC, La Zagaleta, MIZA Investments, and other assets under IHC’s umbrella suggests significant ongoing real estate development and expansion.
example: Construction, architecture, engineering, facility management, property technology, and co-investing funds can partner with IHC’s new real estate entity for mega-projects in the UAE and potentially abroad. For example, a European construction conglomerate or a US proptech scaleup could bid to become strategic partners in sustainable development or smart city initiatives.
roadmap: Step 1: Target IHC’s real estate arm with introductory meetings and pitch decks.
Step 2: Identify specific development projects or investment needs (e.g., smart residential communities, commercial clusters).
Step 3: Submit proposals/joint venture terms for service provision or co-investment.
Step 4: Develop pilot or initial phase partnership.
Step 5: Expand scope within IHC’s development pipeline.
source_name: IHC Achieves Landmark Growth in 2024, Reinforcing Its Position as a Global Investment Powerhouse

title: Strategic M&A and Capital Raise Partnerships
description: IHC orchestrated high-profile acquisitions, including a majority stake in Mopani Copper Mines (mining), Grupo Nutresa (food processing), and Gordon Technologies (energy services). It also participated in IPOs and a multibillion AED share buyback program.
example: Global M&A advisory firms, mining tech suppliers, ESG auditors, PE funds, and sovereign wealth funds can propose co-investment or M&A advisory services to IHC for further cross-border deals in mining, food, energy, or tech. For example, an African mining services company or a midmarket US investment bank can offer buy-side or sell-side services.
roadmap: Step 1: Perform market mapping to identify similar IHC targets or ongoing projects.
Step 2: Contact IHC’s investment/IR teams for deal introductions.
Step 3: Present specific M&A or co-investment theses.
Step 4: Coordinate on due diligence, deal structuring, and post-acquisition integration.
Step 5: Facilitate ongoing partnership and pipeline expansion.
source_name: IHC Achieves Landmark Growth in 2024, Reinforcing Its Position as a Global Investment Powerhouse

title: Co-Development of Logistics and Mobility Infrastructure
description: EasyLease, part of IHC, acquired a controlling stake in Gallega Global Logistics, securing 3.5 million sq. ft. of logistics space. This signals ambitions for growth in the logistics and mobility space.
example: Logistics tech startups, supply chain consultants, warehousing automation providers, or last-mile delivery companies can partner with Gallega or IHC entities to co-locate, digitize, or optimize the new infrastructure in the UAE.
roadmap: Step 1: Introduce logistics tech/value proposition to EasyLease or Gallega management.
Step 2: Scope out needs (automation; supply chain visibility; co-development).
Step 3: Build a pilot project in the UAE’s new logistics hubs.
Step 4: Measure performance, co-market results regionally.
Step 5: Explore further roll-out or investment.
source_name: IHC Achieves Landmark Growth in 2024, Reinforcing Its Position as a Global Investment Powerhouse

title: Access to Transformative Investment Platform (2PointZero) for Emerging Tech Startups
description: IHC launched 2PointZero, a platform aimed at investing in emerging technologies and future-sustaining businesses, combining subsidiaries like Chimera Investments, Lunate Capital, and others.
example: Early-stage and growth-stage startups in emerging technologies (AI, blockchain, fintech, cleantech) can pitch to 2PointZero for capital injection and access to IHC’s vast portfolio and MENA network; for instance, a European renewable energy scaleup or a US Web3 company seeking Middle East market access.
roadmap: Step 1: Research and align business with 2PointZero’s focus sectors.
Step 2: Apply to 2PointZero with a detailed investment pitch.
Step 3: Participate in pitch days and diligence rounds.
Step 4: Secure investment, leverage IHC’s connections for pilot projects or regional expansion.
Step 5: Scale within the IHC platform, with options for deeper collaboration.
source_name: IHC Achieves Landmark Growth in 2024, Reinforcing Its Position as a Global Investment Powerhouse

title: Manpower and Accommodation Solutions Partnerships
description: Following the acquisition of Sawaeed Holding by Emirates Stallions Group (an IHC subsidiary), there is an enhanced platform for workforce services and accommodation offerings.
example: HR tech providers, training companies, facility management firms, or real estate developers can partner with ESG/Sawaeed to deliver new workforce accommodation models (modular, tech-enhanced housing) or digital manpower management solutions across IHC’s diversified companies.
roadmap: Step 1: Connect with the management of ESG and Sawaeed for partnership discussions.
Step 2: Assess current needs for manpower management and accommodation upgrades.
Step 3: Develop and pilot new tech-driven solutions.
Step 4: Roll-out across IHC’s portfolio companies, leveraging IHC’s scale.
Step 5: Build joint offers for third-party enterprises in the region.
source_name: IHC Achieves Landmark Growth in 2024, Reinforcing Its Position as a Global Investment Powerhouse

title: Out-of-Home Digital Advertising Partnerships
description: Multiply Group, a subsidiary of IHC, acquired Backlite Media to expand in digital out-of-home advertising, reinforcing IHC’s commitment to new media sectors.
example: Advertising tech companies, creative studios, digital signage hardware manufacturers, or brands can work with Backlite Media to scale their digital OOH campaigns in the UAE and beyond. For example, a UK-based creative studio could collaborate on interactive ad content leveraging the latest tech.
roadmap: Step 1: Identify and introduce differentiated OOH tech or content partnerships to Multiply/Backlite Media.
Step 2: Align campaign, hardware, or network value propositions.
Step 3: Pilot campaign in specific locations secured by Backlite.
Step 4: Refine, measure, and expand successful ad programs.
Step 5: Co-invest in new display networks or ad tech innovations.
source_name: IHC Achieves Landmark Growth in 2024, Reinforcing Its Position as a Global Investment Powerhouse
